//Thank you to [[user saltywater]] for the excellent banner art!  Check out their [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/saltywater-art | artpage!]]]//


Simply Creative People is the podcast for SCP Creatives.  Two SCP authors ([[*user Grigori Karpin]] and [[*user HarryBlank]]) - along with some guests - get together to discuss stories and their experiences as SCP fans:

* Interviews with content creators
* Discussion and curation of articles/stories/content related to SCP
* Information about content creation
* Larger discussions about the community, the lore and our personal experiences

//Above all else, a fun place to discover the wonders of the SCP Wiki community.//

------
[[=]]
+++ __Episodes__
[[/=]]
@@ @@
[[tabview]]
[[tab 01: A Primer to the SCP Wiki]]
Hello and Welcome to Simply Creative People.  The podcast for creatives and fans of the SCP Wiki, both old and new.  This first episode will serve as a general primer of SCP focused information. Briefly discussing the wiki and then going through a flurry of general information about the universe of SCP!

This first episode was just Grigori, but for the rest of the episodes he is joined by fellow SCP Author, HarryBlank, and a bunch of guests to talk about Groups of Interest on the wiki and to curate a selection of excellent and underrated articles we think you’ll like.

Harry’s Author Page: https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/this-page-intentionally-left-blank
Grigori’s Author Page: https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/grigori-karpin-s-author-page

[[tab 07: Crawling Towards Us Through the Past]]
Today’s show Harry and Grigori delve into the mysterious history of the **//Daeva//**, both in and out of universe.  This blood worshipping, horticultural society that can change history has been with the wiki since almost the beginning and yet only recently had a dedicated hub.  Also, they talk about __finding your voice__ as a creative.

[[tab 09: In the Vanguard]]
Today **Harry** and **Grigori** welcome fellow SCP-6500 author, **Placeholder McDoctorate**, to discuss all the aspects of their baby GOI: **__Vanguard__**.  

Stemming from the dual endings of SCP-6500: Inevitable, Vanguard is a new era in the Foundation’s existence – in more ways than one.  They discuss the contents of SCP-6500 in relation to Vanguard, the development of this new GOI, and what they hope the readers take away from it.  Additionally, let this episode serve as an open invitation for more writers to contribute this new world of SCP.

**Harry’s Author Page**: https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/this-page-intentionally-left-blank

[[tab 30: Totally Soft]]
This week we welcome our favorite SCP author, Daveyoufool, creator of Three Moons Initiative and author of Neverstone a LitRPG novel series, to talk about his other crazy GOI: TotleighSoft. Imagine an eldritch horror arriving in the heartland of America, now imagine this horror doesn't want to eat people or ruin the world, it just wants to live the American dream. Also, it has no idea how to behave like a human but tries its best. That's TotleighSoft. And its manic, absurd, horrifying, and absolutely wonderful. Plus stick around for a discussion of how we manage our creative time and easily the funniest end to the podcast we've had since starting.

[[tab 32: Recontextualizing SCP]]
This week Grigori and Harry welcome Captain Kirby (fairly legendary author on the SCP Wiki and co-creator of the End of Death canon) to discuss a very interesting subject: Stories that recontextualize or reinvent or reinterpret an older more established idea/character on the wiki.  The wiki has been around about 15 years now, and it’s a fairly common thing when a newer author looks back at something published to the wiki in the years previous and thinks “Hey I could do something cool with this.”  

So come along with us as we explore the recontextualization of SCP.

[[tab 34: Simply Hungry People]]
This week Grigori and Harry welcome the ever-talented producer, director, and writer of the SCP fiction podcast Find Us Alive: Raddagher! (she also has an excellent library of articles on the wiki!) 

The Group of Interest we’re discussing this episode is Ambrose Restaurants – the anomalous chain of fine dining eateries that serve the anomalous world! * **TV & Book Series**: The Expanse, Culture, Good Omens

* **Comic**: Seven Soldiers, Tom Strong Compendium, Grendel
